translated: “Then again, when I was the son
and I was raised in a prison;

analyzed: sa raṭṭhakam sa nigama  sa janam vanditvā khattiya
translated: The people of the country and the villages,
and the people who had paid homage to the prince,
raised their joined palms🔽and spoke this statement:

analyzed: ye keci mahiyā sattā  hīna mukkaṭṭha majjhimā
translated: ‘Whatever beings there are in the world,🔽low, high, or in between,
without protection in their own homes,
are increased by their own relatives.
This is the highest in the world,
when the moon and sun were faint.
I was released from my mother’s womb;
Then, in even more terrible suffering,
I was thrown into a prison again.
If I have attained such a state,
it would be the worst of evils.
I am disgusted with the body,
I have no use for royal splendor.

analyzed: yattha mam mat cu na mad diye

translated: while the great crowd was lamenting,
like an elephant breaking its bonds,

original: pāvisiṁ kānanaṁ vanaṁ.🔽Mātāpitā na me dessā,🔽napi me dessaṁ mahāyasaṁ;
analyzed: pāvisim kānanam vana  mātā pitā na me dessā  napi me dessam mahāyasa
translated: I entered the forest grove.🔽My mother and father were not dear to me,🔽nor was my great splendor.
